noun.description: A person who ruffs at cards. rare.
Chiefly Whist and Bridge. A card that ruffs or trumps another.

origin: Early 17th century; earliest use found in John Florio (1553–1625), author and teacher of languages. From ruff + -er<br>mid 19th century; earliest use found in Andrew Ure (1778–1857), chemist. Either a variant of rougher, or from ruff + -er.
